ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] H3: Severe Problem or misconfiguration
ygData.msgSnippet: The SEVERE errors you re seeing suggest some corruption in the on-disk queues such that they don t have the expected structure. Most helpful in understanding

X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The SEVERE errors you're seeing suggest some corruption in the on-disk 
queues such that they don't have the expected structure.

Most helpful in understanding what happened would be the very first such 
WARNING or SEVERE errors in the job.log, and any other errors/exceptions 
that might appear at that time or before, in the job.log or 
heritrix_out.log on disk.

This could be a new bug, so I'm interested in seeing what other hints 
are in your logs. However, such corruption could also be triggered by a 
momentary bit of memory or disk/IO corruption, so checking that the 
system is healthy is also appropriate. (Checking system logs, filesystem 
integrity, or using disk diagnostics like 'SMART' may be helpful.)

- Gordon @ IA

t.schoellhorn wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> currently I am running a crawl with 500 seeds. After some hours the an error occurs repeatedely in the job.log. It occurs that often, so that the job.log gets 500 MB big - so I assume that something is seriously wrong here (see attachted job.log excerpt). 
> 
> As I honestly have no idea what is going on I try to attach my crawler-beans.xml so that someone might get an idea what I am doing wrong or what is going on.
> 
> I'd be glad for any suggestions what I can try to solve that problem. 
> 
> Cheers,
> Tino
> 
> 
>
